alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Coffey; Franklin; Osage (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 6:29PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Franklin, Anderson, southeastern Osage and northeastern Coffey Counties through 700 PM CDT... At 627 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Williamsburg to 3 miles east of Westphalia. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Torrential rainfall, winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Ponding on roadways and flooding of low-lying areas may occur. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ottawa, Garnett, Wellsville, Waverly, Richmond, Williamsburg, Greeley, Princeton, Lane, Rantoul, Westphalia and Harris. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 163 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
